search_result.link_content_summary:
{
 "Summary": "Today, Symrise entered into an agreement to acquire all shares in International Dehydrated Foods LLC and several others. This transaction is a strategic acquisition of an all-natural Nutrition business with annual sales of USD220 million and an adjusted EBITDA of USD51 million.",
 "Company Name": "Symrise AG",
 "Email": "ir@symrise.com",
 "Phone Number": "+49 (0)5531 90 0",
 "Address": "Mühlenfeldstraße 1\n37603 Holzminden\nGermany",
 "Product Information": "develops and produces pet food and food product solutions. The company is specialized in natural dehydrated meat and poultry ingredients.",
 "Representative": "Tobias Erfurth",
 "Useful Information": "Symrise plans to invest approximately USD 900 million for the acquisition in this transaction and has already secured the required bridge financing."
}

search_result.link_content_summary:
{
 "Summary": "The Justice Department announced today that it will require Symrise AG to divest its chicken-based food ingredient manufacturing facility in Banks County, Georgia, in order to proceed with its proposed $900 million acquisition of International Dehydrated Foods LLC (IDF) and American Dehydrated Foods LLC (ADF) from IDF Holdco Inc. and ADF Holdco Inc.\n\nThe proposed merger would have given the combined company control over 75 percent of the domestic market for the manufacture and sale of chicken-based food ingredients, and the Justice Department determined that without the required divestiture, the combined company likely would have been able to increase prices and reduce service and quality, and diminish innovation in the market for chicken-based food ingredients.",
 "Company Name": "Symrise AG",
 "Email": "None",
 "Phone Number": "None",
 "Address": "Holzminden, Germany",
 "Product Information": "chicken-based food ingredients",
 "Representative": "None",
 "Useful Information": "IDF and ADF are privately held companies headquartered in Springfield, Missouri, whose operations include two chicken-based food ingredient plants in Alabama and Missouri.  The companies’ combined 2018 revenue for chicken-based food ingredients used in human and pet food manufacturing was approximately $177 million"
}
